p:
Regarding the biological parameters, the winter decay rate of the CS strain was much higher than that of the ESs strains (0.5 vs. 0), reflecting a high competitive advantage of the ESs. The value

= 0.44
km
2
per day of the diffusion coefficient indicates that a virus travels about
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$1.2$$\end{document}
1.2
km per day in average during the growing season of cucurbit crops (see Supplementary Note S7). The growth rate of

day
- 1
corresponds to an increase by a factor

0.31

each day, in the absence of competition.
